e4: I recommend changing to the new policy because it aligns with ethical standards for financial reporting, fostering transparency and investor confidence. While some investors may initially misinterpret the true earnings, this shift reduces legal risks and potential future complications associated with biased reporting. In the long run, a transparent approach will likely strengthen the company's reputation and relationship with all investors.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should prioritize accuracy, transparency, and fairness, providing investors with truthful information to make informed decisions. It should avoid intentional bias or misleading practices, regardless of investor awareness. Additionally, ethical reporting considers the long-term impacts on stakeholder trust and legal compliance, promoting a culture of integrity and accountability within the organization.
e6: Yes, I would ask management how they plan to communicate the transition to the new policy to all investors, especially retail investors, to ensure understanding and mitigate confusion. Additionally, I would inquire about the strategies they will implement to monitor investor reactions and address any potential concerns post-transition.
